content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 2 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is "x." The heading for row 2 is "f of x." The heading for row 3 is "f prime of x." The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2. f of x is 4. f prime of x is 2. Column 2. x is 5. f of x is 7. f prime of x is 3." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives values of the differentiable function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative <math alttext="f prime" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> at selected values of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="the integral from 2 to 5, of, f of x, d x, equals 14" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="the integral from 2 to 5, of, x times f prime of x, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>⋅</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 6.11: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Integration by Parts

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
